channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Millions of student-loan borrowers have no idea how much they’re supposed to pay
item.description: Balances increasing, forgiveness paused — the “level of confusion is just crazy.”

item.title: Trade Desk’s stock may see its worst drop ever, and analysts wonder if Amazon is to blame
item.description: Some say newfound competition is pressuring Trade Desk’s growth, but the ad-tech company’s CEO says Amazon is limited because it competes against mark...

item.title: Wendy’s cuts profit outlook as U.S. sales stay weak. Its stock is rising.
item.description: CEO Ken Cook said the company has “more work to do” to improve its U.S. business, which saw sales fall for a second straight quarter.

item.title: ‘Stagflation is coming to the U.S.,’ says this economist. Here’s what it means for the dollar, bonds and stocks.
item.description: The greenback faces a Wile E. Coyote moment says Savvas Savouri

item.title: Under Armour’s stock dives, as CEO doesn’t like what tariffs are doing to profits
item.description: Under Armour’s fiscal second quarter outlook fell below Wall Street’s expectations, and the company again did not provide full-year outlook.

item.title: Goldman sees more than 60% upside ahead for Peloton after strong results
item.description: Analyst Eric Sheridan upgraded the connected fitness company to a price target that suggests more than 61% potential upside.

item.title: Friday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: The Dow Industrials fell on Thursday, dropping more than 200 points after a sharp reversal in the session. Here's what's on CNBC's radar going into Fr...

item.title: Why Tesla's latest move could be a boon for Nvidia, AMD
item.description: Tesla's move to shut down its Dojo supercomputer team likely increases its usage of general purpose GPUs for AI, Wells Fargo said.

item.title: Value investor Bill Nygren breaks down how he's finding hidden gems in an expensive stock market
item.description: While his picks don't offer exceptional organic growth, Nygren looks for the companies that have solid repurchase or dividend programs in place.
